```{r}
library(plotly)

df <- data.frame(
  klasse = 1:9,
  transgressive = c(0.3, 0.2, 0.7, 0.1, 0, 0, 0.08, 0, 0),  # Voeg hier je scores in
  social_climate = c(0.9, 0.8, 0.7, 0.6, 0.2, 0.4, 0.3, 0.1, 0.5),  # Voeg hier je scores in
  conflict = c(0.8, 0.7, 0.6, 0.4, 0.1, 0, 0.9, 0, 0.5)  # Voeg hier je scores in
)

plot_ly(
  data = df,
  x = ~transgressive,
  y = ~social_climate,
  z = ~conflict,
  color = ~klasse,
  type = 'scatter3d',
  mode = 'markers',
  marker = list(size = 8)
)

```


```{r}
library(ggplot2)
library(reshape2)

# Data frame with yes/no (1/0) for each class and dimension
data <- data.frame(
  Class = factor(1:9),
  Transgressive = c(1, 1, 1, 1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0),
  Conflict = c(1, 1, 1, 1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 1),
  Social_Climate = c(1, 0, 1, 1, 0, 1, 0, 0, 1)
)

# Reshape the data into long format
data_long <- melt(data, id.vars = 'Class')

# Plot heatmap
ggplot(data_long, aes(x = variable, y = Class, fill = factor(value))) +
  geom_tile() +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c('white', 'blue')) +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(x = 'Dimension', y = 'Class', fill = 'Presence') +
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))

```

```{r}
ggplot(data, aes(x = Transgressive, y = Conflict, color = factor(Social_Climate))) +
  geom_point(size = 4) +
  labs(x = "Transgressive Behaviors", y = "Conflict", color = "Social Climate") +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("red", "green")) +
  theme_minimal()

```

```{r}
install.packages("venn")
library(venn)

# Define the sets
sets <- list(
  Transgressive = which(data$Transgressive == 1),
  Conflict = which(data$Conflict == 1),
  Social_Climate = which(data$Social_Climate == 1)
)

# Plot the Venn diagram
venn(sets)

```

```{r}
install.packages("fmsb")
library(fmsb)

# Create data for the radar plot (0 = No, 1 = Yes)
radar_data <- data.frame(
  Class = 1:9,
  Transgressive = c(1, 1, 1, 1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0),
  Conflict = c(1, 1, 1, 1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 1),
  Social_Climate = c(1, 0, 1, 1, 0, 1, 0, 0, 1)
)

# Radar plot
radarchart(radar_data)

```
```{r}
library(plotly)

# Data for the 3D scatter plot
data_3d <- data.frame(
  Class = factor(1:9),
  Transgressive = c(1, 1, 1, 1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 0),
  Conflict = c(1, 1, 1, 1, 0, 0, 1, 0, 1),
  Social_Climate = c(1, 0, 1, 1, 0, 1, 0, 0, 1),
  Supervisor_Coworker = c("Both", "Coworker", "Both", "Supervisor", "Neither", "Neither", "Both", "Neither", "Neither")
)

# 3D plot with Transgressive, Conflict, Social Climate, and colored by Supervisor/Coworker
plot_ly(data_3d, x = ~Transgressive, y = ~Conflict, z = ~Social_Climate, color = ~Supervisor_Coworker, type = 'scatter3d', mode = 'markers')

```
